stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Kestrel
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] 20 Years
[Place of Birth] Sargon
[Date of Birth] Reported as Unknown
[Race] Liberi
[Height] 170cm
[Infection Status]
 Confirmed Infected by medical examination

[Physical Strength] Standard 
[Mobility] Normal 
[Physical Resilience] Excellent 
[Tactical Acumen] Normal 
[Combat Skill] Standard 
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

Formerly a warrior of a Szubat-Arsalan tribe in Sargon, Kestrel and her siblings were enslaved by the local lord ameer's army. Encountering Rhodes Island personnel during her escape, she was able to return to the mines and rescue the other workers. She later joined Rhodes Island and is currently employed at the Sargonian branch, receiving treatment while participating in field missions.

Imaging tests show the indistinct outlines of internal organs, obscured by abnormal shadows. Originium granules detected in the circulatory system. The subject is confirmed to be infected with Oripathy.

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 3.7%
Operator Kestrel shows signs of mild Oripathy infection, but leads a life that is little different from the uninfected.

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.26u/L
Working in dangerous Originium mines without proper protection has had a significant impact on Operator Kestrel's health. Her BOCD is well above normal levels and requires regular monitoring. While we have instructed her to take it easy in her everyday life, it seems unlikely that she would be willing to sit around all day. The best we can do is recommend that she avoids high-risk field missions.

The people of her tribe had a custom of painting 'tooth marks' with mineral paint. It remains to be seen whether this has a negative effect on her condition.
- Warfarin, Medical Department

Kestrel is a Sargonian warrior who is as straightforward as they come.
She began frequenting the training room shortly after arriving at headquarters, confidently walking in like she had always been a regular. Her relationship with the combat experts of Rhodes Island began with a clash of weapons, putting on a show of Sargonian tribal swordplay that the operators in the training room had never seen before. They eagerly invited her to come back for more.
Her favorite hangout is the bar; although she has been warned against excessive drinking, she can often be spotted doing so from dusk to dawn at the bar for weeks on end. Ultimately, the Medical Department decided to bring her in by force, but Kestrel refused the 'treatment'; being under the influence only seemed to make her sword strike faster and harder. Treatment finally began when her training room friends arrived and successfully restrained her with great effort, only for everyone to realize that treatment was unnecessary after all: unlike most drunks who deny being drunk, Kestrel was, in fact, unimpaired. If anything, the alcohol had only served to hone her swordsmanship.

[Medical Department Audio Log]
'That Kestrel, from Sargon. Can you believe what her tests show?'
'What do you mean?'
'Do you know how much she drinks? Yet it doesn't seem to have any effect on her vitals.'
'Wish I were like that.'

Many Rhodes Island operators have their fair share of scars, which serves as a way to introduce themselves.
'I got this during the Sarkaz Civil War...'
'I got this during Columbia's Great Expansion...'
'I got this when I hit my head on a table when I was three!'
'That doesn't count!'
Kestrel was rather reticent about this topic at first, as the trials of her past left no visible marks on her skin. This bothered her, as she saw scars from battle as something to be proud of.
As she began to blend in, she realized that her 'tooth marks' serve equally well as a conversation starter. When asked about the meaning of a 'guardian tooth mark', she ended up giving a lecture about the meanings of various marks.
'What would Rhodes Island's tooth mark embody?'
'That depends on what Rhodes Island is about.'
'Let's say... 'future'.'
'My tribe didn't have that kind of mark, but we can invent one.'
Kestrel began inventing her first 'tooth mark' after receiving such a request. Shutting herself in her room, she spent two days drawing up the pattern, and hung it up in the cafeteria to the sound of cheering.
As the crowd came forward to embrace her, she felt, for the first time, that she had truly been accepted.
She still thinks back to the people and events of her past, but no longer finds her lack of scars to be a handicap. Rather, she is happy to share the origins of her 'tooth marks,' and to carry on the tradition of her people in her new home.

Medical checks revealed nothing of particular note. We suspect that painting these 'tooth marks' with mineral paints may have something to do with how external trauma leaves no mark on her skin, but no firm conclusions have been reached for now.
- Warfarin, Medical Department

Kestrels holds great respect for the tribal chief who brought her up.
By tradition, women of the tribe undergo trials to become defenders of hearth and home. The chief was the one who took the homeless Kestrel in and raised her to become a brave warrior. She was a beautiful and kind leader who taught her tribe to turn abandoned ruins into settlements with plenty of water and rich soil.
The threat of the Lord Ameer was constantly looming over their heads, though. In order to oppose the Lord Ameer, the chief traveled to numerous other tribes to build alliances, taking Kestrel along with her. In her free time, she discussed with the young Kestrel what kinds of body paint looked best, and gave Kestrel 'tooth marks' symbolizing 'Protection.'
Kestrel learned that the chief preferred white for 'tooth marks'.
In subsequent years, she used the 'tooth mark' that her mentor gave her, in her favorite color, while fighting a hopeless war against the Lord Ameer's soldiers with the few comrades she had left, until she was the only one left.

A psychological assessment was performed on Operator Kestrel to mitigate potential risks in field missions.
We learned through interviews that revenge became her purpose after the destruction of her tribe, but that it came to a stop at some point.
According to her, during her stint in the mines, she took in some children who had also been enslaved in the mines. At their request, she agreed to teach them to use a blade in order to take revenge for their families.
However, she had underestimated the price of revenge. Witnessing the deaths of those children led her to look back on the purpose she had pursued for so many years, and the results that came of it. No longer obsessed with vengeance, she turned her sights back to the original connotations of 'Protection,' and began to see inciting revenge as an evil.
She came to the conclusion that her current life matters more, and that Rhodes Island is her new home that she must protect. As such, she has requested a reassignment to the Sargonian branch to participate in field missions.
We must inform the Sargonian office ahead of time to keep an eye on Kestrel's condition in the field, investigate any faction that has a history with her, and require her to regularly return to HQ for psychological evaluation and Oripathy monitoring.

Kestrel still has many mysteries, as there are details in her personal history that can no longer be verified, and her own account is sometimes confused or fragmented. It must be emphasized, however, that this is no reason not to put our trust in her.
- HR Department Note

The sun is setting.
Kestrel stands up from the roof of the office building she had been lying on, pulls out her horn, and blows it towards the setting sun.
She had explained to curious operators that the horn symbolized the celebration of victory, or the passing of a peaceful and quiet day.
Today's horn is particularly long, because this is her first day at the office as an official operator of Rhodes Island.
Kestrel blows it a little longer for the important events in her life.
The first time was her very first victory in battle. Their armies charged downhill and routed the Lord Ameer's soldiers. She had volunteered to be the vanguard, and saved the life of her friend with the sword her chief had taught her to wield. That day, she learned what it meant to be a comrade, and she blew her horn longer.
The second was when she led the slave revolt through the mine shafts, filled with fog and enemies. She took the rear guard, fighting off pursuers all night, until she saw with her own eyes that the miners had reached safety. That day, she learned that the purpose of the sword was to protect, and she blew her horn longer.
This is the third time.

skins.description:
An outfit commonly worn by Operators.
While not as practical as a uniform, it's what they find most comfortable.

An outfit that has been improved after the Operator's Promotion.
Custom-made to suit each Operator's experiences and needs, these outfits are designed to provide them maximum flexibility on any battlefield. Furthermore, this is all done without compromising the comfort that they've come to expect.

candidates.name: A Matter of Habit

modules.desc:
Operator Kestrel has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for preemptive penetration of the battlefield situation and active offense so as to secure leeway for deployment.
This operator shall hereby be appointed a Vanguard Operator during field operations to exercise Pioneer responsibilities.
In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named.

Making distance from a ruin they personally set alight, Kestrel takes her group back to their initial gathering point. The fire rages on, and even when the skies open up, the rain can't even touch the flames before it steams away midair, leaving only the sound of crackling.
Breaking the silence, someone asks Kestrel. 'Boss, how many did you kill today?'
'Can't remember.'
'Who would remember after the heat of battle how many they killed, youngster?' a weary voice adds. 'To survive is already a job well done.'
Kestrel lets the topic lapse, but that twisted face comes to mind. The one of an 'old acquaintance' scared shitless. The one she closed in on with every step. The one with no alternative but to jump from the roof. The one who left her only that face, one moment before melting into the sea of flames.
She knew who that was. The assassin who murdered her friend.
'Still, this victory's worth celebrating. Today, we wiped out a few more of the killers who slaughtered our people.' Kestrel comes to a stop, looks back, sees the descendants she's brought along. The distant flames flicker in her eyes.
They raise a cheer, but Kestrel doesn't smile.
'So how many killers to go?' asks again the one who broke the silence.
Kestrel gazes over. It's a girl, still young. If the tribe still was, she would never be part of these fighters. She would be living her youth, a bright one, a happy one.
Oh. That's right. She doesn't even have a 'tooth mark'.
'You showed a great display today. I've now decided you should be rewarded with a 'tooth mark.' Kestrel fails to directly answer the girl's question. 'While we return, you can think about what style of mark you'd like.'
'Really?'
A feeling hits Kestrel. She's had this conversation. She was the girl before her. She, the girl, before the tribe's chief, the one who raised her—the one who was dearest to her, the one who outlined, over her left shoulder, the very first band of her 'tooth mark'.
Kestrel can't help but hug that shoulder tight, the warm memory almost abating the cold rainy eve, but it's only a moment before she comes to. For they, stood in the rain, are waiting for her.
'Really—now let's get back to the gathering point quick. I'll find the box, and then you'll be able to choose.'
The group begins to slowly move, their figures gradually melting into the dark of night, never to be seen again.

missionList.desc: Complete a total of 5 battles; You must deploy your own Kestrel, and unleash Drunken Bladedance at least 2 times in each battle

Clear Main Theme 11-18 with a 3-star rating under Standard Environment; You must deploy your own Kestrel, Kestrel must be the first deployed, and Kestrel cannot retreat or be defeated for the entire stage

talents.name: A Matter of Habit

voice_lines.voiceText: Here are the documents. If that's all, I'll be going... The stain on that sheet? Oh, that's, uh... I guess I did spill something when I was having a couple of drinks last night. Haha... Damn, I put it in the middle of the stack, how'd you catch it...?

Do cultured folks like you even drink? Come, come, let's take a swig together, okay? Climb the hills in the dark, cross the desert in a storm. Now we gather in the oasis, drinking all the finest booze… Hehehe, oh, my friend, let's return to our homeland…

Why are you all wrapped up like that on such a warm day? You'll be drenched in sweat. Hey you! Yes, you! Why don't you take off that jacket? A true warrior isn't afraid to show the results of hard training!

'Operator'? No, I'm a warrior of Rhodes Island. Don't worry, it's not because I can't let go of the past, but because I want to defend the present. I'll train new warriors for you... same as I was taken in and raised back on the sands.

I once took in some war orphans. They begged me to teach them how to use a sword to get revenge. I agreed, and they succeeded, but at the cost of their lives… Many years ago, the chief taught me that the sword is only for protection.

The war took the lives of everyone in my tribe. My friends blocked blows with their bodies, and the chief's blood dripped onto my head... Me and the other children set out on a path of revenge. I'm the only one left. No one and nothing else. Only me.

The mark I'm drawing on your forearm? It's a 'bite mark'. Look, I have one too. The chief carved it into my skin herself. She said that those who have undergone the trial of blood and pain become the bravest warriors. The mark brings us strength.

I've taken plenty of hits both in battle and in the mines, but not many left marks. I used to think I was lucky, but now I wish I wasn't. I want the scars to help me remember certain people and things. Death brings back nothing, you know. I have to stay alive, and carry them myself.

Is it snowing on that peak...? Ohh... Guess what, Doctor? I had a dream last night about sleeping in the chief's arms when I was first taken in. She stroked my forehead gently, and her palm was like the sun-scorched sand, warm and rough. They've never seen the snow. Now I see it for them.
It's a beautiful day out there. I had a good nap, and a good dream, for once.
I choose to stand here, and so the land beneath my feet is my home.
No need, I'll grab my weapon and shield and head to the training grounds.
It's a warrior's duty, no need to thank me... Wha? Blushing? Of course I'm not blushing. How could you even tell I'm blushing through my tan?
Thanks, Doctor... I'll take this medal back to my homeland. The spring there has dried up, but it will continue to bless me, and they will know that I'm still fighting.
Love, friends, hearth. That's what a warrior lives for.
Warriors! Your courage will bring glory.
Don't eat too much before a battle, unless you want to throw it all up.
Now we fight!
I'm well prepared!
My sword is honed.
You're not getting past me!
I see them.
Victory or death!
We will defend our home!
The enemy will never see our backs!
Raise your weapons and shields! Not one step back!
This is the home that we defend. This is where they die.
The invaders' swords cut their own throats. An end they deserve.
Haha, it is an honor to die defending my home.
My homeland, my friends, my love... they're all waiting for me.
The heck? No alcohol here...? Huh? What's that in my mug? It's just some b… umm... bubbly barley juice.
Hey! Hands off.
Hahaha! Oh, I hate being tickled…
Arknights.
The strongest liquor for the bravest warrior. This one is mine, Doctor. If you really want it... devour this whole roasted game, and you'll be our hero for the day!
Yo, Doctor, you sure you don't need to sun a bit?
I made this drinking horn out of the sands of my tribal homeland. A new warrior blows her victory horn after her first battle, celebrating her arrival into the world.

It's hard to describe what I felt when I first saw Rhodes Island sail by in the distance, the rumbling of the ship and the tremor of the sands... it's like my chief was whispering in my ear: You've found another place worth fighting for.

building_skills.desc: When this Operator is assigned to the Control Center, all Operators in Dormitories recover <@cc.vup>+0.05</> Morale per hour (strongest effect of the same type applies)
When this Operator is assigned to the Control Center, increases Morale of all Operators in the Control Center by <@cc.vup>+0.05</> per hour.
